titles: The wonderful praise of a good husband or, The kind and careful mothers counsel to her daughter. Bad husbands they, oft run astray, as being most unkind: but good we see, will always be of a far better mind. To the tune of, My life and my death; or, The poor man's counsellor.
notes: Verse: "Dear daughter, i'de have thee to take special care ..."
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
